 *  See https://github.com/ethereum/solidity/pull/11843[ethereum/solidity#11843] for more info.
 *
 *  In order to clean an EnumerableSet, you can either remove all elements one by one or create a fresh instance using an array of EnumerableSet.

library EnumerableSet {
    // To implement this library for multiple types with as little code
    // repetition as possible, we write it in terms of a generic Set type with
    // bytes32 values.
    // The Set implementation uses private functions, and user-facing
    // implementations (such as AddressSet) are just wrappers around the
    // underlying Set.
    // This means that we can only create new EnumerableSets for types that fit
    // in bytes32.

    struct Set {
        // Storage of set values
        bytes32[] _values;
        // Position of the value in the `values` array, plus 1 because index 0
        // means a value is not in the set.
        mapping(bytes32 => uint256) _indexes;
    }

    /**
     * @dev Add a value to a set. O(1).
     *
     * Returns true if the value was added to the set, that is if it was not
     * already present.
     */
    function _add(Set storage set, bytes32 value) private returns (bool) {
        if (!_contains(set, value)) {
            set._values.push(value);
            // The value is stored at length-1, but we add 1 to all indexes
            // and use 0 as a sentinel value
            set._indexes[value] = set._values.length;
            return true;
        } else {
            return false;
        }
    }

    /**
     * @dev Removes a value from a set. O(1).
     *
     * Returns true if the value was removed from the set, that is if it was
     * present.
     */

        // We read and store the value's index to prevent multiple reads from the same storage slot
        uint256 valueIndex = set._indexes[value];

        if (valueIndex != 0) {
            // Equivalent to contains(set, value)
            // To delete an element from the _values array in O(1), we swap the element to delete with the last one in
            // the array, and then remove the last element (sometimes called as 'swap and pop').
            // This modifies the order of the array, as noted in {at}.

            uint256 toDeleteIndex = valueIndex - 1;
            uint256 lastIndex = set._values.length - 1;

            if (lastIndex != toDeleteIndex) {
                bytes32 lastValue = set._values[lastIndex];

                // Move the last value to the index where the value to delete is
                set._values[toDeleteIndex] = lastValue;
                // Update the index for the moved value
                set._indexes[lastValue] = valueIndex; // Replace lastValue's index to valueIndex
            }

            // Delete the slot where the moved value was stored
            set._values.pop();

            // Delete the index for the deleted slot
            delete set._indexes[value];

            return true;
        } else {
            return false;
        }
    }

     * @dev Returns true if the value is in the set. O(1).
     */
    function _contains(Set storage set, bytes32 value) private view returns (bool) {
        return set._indexes[value] != 0;
    }

     * @dev Returns the number of values on the set. O(1).
     */
    function _length(Set storage set) private view returns (uint256) {
        return set._values.length;
    }

     *

    function _at(Set storage set, uint256 index) private view returns (bytes32) {
        return set._values[index];
    }

    /**

     */
    function _values(Set storage set) private view returns (bytes32[] memory) {
        return set._values;
    }

    // Bytes32Set

    struct Bytes32Set {
        Set _inner;
    }

    /**

     *

    }

    /**

     */

        return _remove(set._inner, value);
    }

    /**
     * @dev Returns true if the value is in the set. O(1).
     */

        return _contains(set._inner, value);
    }

     */
    function length(Bytes32Set storage set) internal view returns (uint256) {
        return _length(set._inner);
    }

    }

        return _remove(set._inner, bytes32(uint256(uint160(value))));
    }

pragma solidity ^0.8.17;

// Brian Doyle github.com/briandoyle81

import "hardhat/console.sol";
import "@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC721/IERC721Receiver.sol";
import "@openzeppelin/contracts/access/Ownable.sol";
import "@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/structs/EnumerableSet.sol";

import "./BCUtils.sol";
import "./BCTypes.sol";

// TODO: When implementing adding items that were not minted via BC
// TODO: check against a naughty list of items that are banned
// TODO: This should inherit from a UIF receiver contract

interface LobbyInterface {
    // TODO: Commit item to player inventory for game
}

interface GameInterface {
    function placeWorldItems(
        uint _gameId,
        uint[] memory _itemIds,
        uint _row,
        uint _col
    ) external;

    function deleteWorldItems(uint[] calldata _worldItemIds) external;

    function extGetGamePlayerIndexes(
        uint _gameId
    ) external view returns (uint[] memory);
}

interface UIFInterface {
    function mintItem(
        uint _type,
        uint _quality,
        address _minter
    ) external payable returns (uint);

    function extGetProperties(uint _id) external view returns (bytes32);

    function extGetCurrentOwner(uint _id) external view returns (address);

    function ownerOf(uint256 _id) external view returns (address);

    function extGetUIIsOwned(
        address _currentOwner
    ) external view returns (uint[] memory);

    // function burn(uint _id) external;

    function setCurrentOwner(
        address _newOwner,
        address _oldOwner,
        uint _id
    ) external;
}

interface PlayersContract {
    function extGetPlayerOwner(uint _id) external view returns (address);
}

contract BCItems is IERC721Receiver, Ownable, BCUtils {
    using EnumerableSet for EnumerableSet.UintSet;

    LobbyInterface public lobbies;
    address public gamesContract;
    UIFInterface public uif;
    address public actionsContract;
    GameInterface public games;
    PlayersContract public playersContract;

    function setContractAddresses(
        address _lobbyContractAddress,
        address _gameContract,
        address _UIFAddress,
        address _actionsContract,
        address _playersContract
    ) public onlyOwner {
        lobbies = LobbyInterface(_lobbyContractAddress);
        gamesContract = _gameContract;
        games = GameInterface(_gameContract);
        uif = UIFInterface(_UIFAddress);
        actionsContract = _actionsContract;
        playersContract = PlayersContract(_playersContract);
    }

    uint public mintCost = 100 gwei; // TODO: Set these

    bool public mintIsActive = true; // TODO: Is this still useful?

    event Received();

    // TODO: Add company items using standard item in UIF

    BCTypes.Item[] public items;
    mapping(uint256 => EnumerableSet.UintSet) playerToItems; // TODO: Handle if made upgradeable
    mapping(uint256 => EnumerableSet.UintSet) gameToItems;
    mapping(address => EnumerableSet.UintSet) ownedItems; // Items out of game

    constructor() {
        // Use 0 for no modifiers
        // TODO: BURN ZERO
    }

    function spawnCompanyItem() public payable {
        // TODO: Make copies of a specific item using the standard items mechanism in UIF
        // TODO: Remove owner free call
        // TODO: DRY
        require(
            msg.sender == owner() || msg.value == mintCost,
            "Incorrect payment"
        );
        require(
            msg.sender == owner() || mintIsActive == true,
            "Minting is not active"
        );
        require(msg.sender == owner() || msg.sender == address(gamesContract));
        // TODO: Implement
    }

    // Create a new item that goes directly to a player's inventory
    // IE Draw from the item deck
    // ID of the _player_ holding this item
    function lootItem(
        uint _holdingPlayerId,
        address _holderAddress,
        uint _gameId
    ) public payable {
        // TODO: Remove owner free call
        string memory paymentError = string(
            abi.encodePacked("Payed: ", msg.value, ", cost is: ", mintCost)
        );
        require(msg.sender == owner() || msg.value == mintCost, paymentError);
        // require(msg.sender == owner() || mintIsActive == true, "Minting is not active");
        // TODO: Finalize allowed senders
        require(
            msg.sender == owner() ||
                msg.sender == address(gamesContract) ||
                msg.sender == actionsContract,
            "Contract not allowed"
        );

        _createNewItem(_holdingPlayerId, _holderAddress, _gameId);
    }

    // Pick up world items and give them to the player
    function pickupWorldItems(
        uint _playerId,
        uint[] calldata _itemIds,
        address _newOwnerAddress
    ) public {
        require(
            msg.sender == address(actionsContract),
            "Not actions contract - pickupWorldItems"
        );

        for (uint i = 0; i < _itemIds.length; i++) {
            // Set UniversalInventoryItem.currentOwner in UIF // TODO: This should take an array, would save gas
            uif.setCurrentOwner(
                _newOwnerAddress,
                address(0),
                items[_itemIds[i]].uifID
            );

            playerToItems[_playerId].add(_itemIds[i]);

            BCTypes.Item storage item = items[_itemIds[i]];
            item.holdingPlayerId = _playerId;
            item.status = BCTypes.WorldItemStatus.HELD;
            item.position = BCTypes.Position(0, 0);
        }
    }

    // Spawn world items when a player drops them // TODO: Consider renaming, or also use to drop items in world
    function spawnWorldItems(
        uint _gameId,
        uint[] memory _itemIds,
        uint _row,
        uint _col,
        uint _formerOwnerId
    ) public {
        require(
            msg.sender == address(actionsContract) ||
                msg.sender == address(playersContract),
            "Not actions or players contract - spawnWorldItems"
        );
        if (_itemIds.length == 0) {
            return;
        }

        // TODO: Make sure item system doesn't allow reclaiming these
        // Set owner in UIF                                         // TODO: Assumption
        address formerOwnerAddress = playersContract.extGetPlayerOwner(
            items[_itemIds[0]].holdingPlayerId
        );
        for (uint i = 0; i < _itemIds.length; i++) {
            uif.setCurrentOwner(
                address(0),
                formerOwnerAddress,
                items[_itemIds[i]].uifID
            );
            _removeItemFromPlayerToItem(_formerOwnerId, _itemIds[i]);
            BCTypes.Item storage item = items[_itemIds[i]];
            item.holdingPlayerId = 0;
            item.status = BCTypes.WorldItemStatus.ON_GROUND;
            item.position = BCTypes.Position(uint8(_row), uint8(_col));
        }
    }

    function dropAllItems(
        uint _gameId,
        uint _playerId,
        uint _row,
        uint _col
    ) public {
        require(
            msg.sender == address(playersContract),
            "Not players contract - dropAllItems"
        );

        uint[] memory itemIds = playerToItems[_playerId].values();
        spawnWorldItems(_gameId, itemIds, _row, _col, _playerId);
    }

    // Attach items to a player as they enlist (currentGame must still be set)
    function addItemsToPlayer(
        uint _playerId,
        uint[] memory _itemIds,
        address _owner
    ) public {
        require(
            msg.sender == address(playersContract),
            "Not players contract - addItemsToPlayer"
        );

        for (uint i = 0; i < _itemIds.length; i++) {
            uint itemId = _itemIds[i];
            BCTypes.Item storage item = items[itemId];
            require(
                item.holdingPlayerId == 0,
                "Someone is already holding this!"
            );
            require(
                item.ownerAddress == _owner,
                "Owner for item and char don't match"
            );
            item.holdingPlayerId = _playerId;
            item.ownerAddress = address(0);

            playerToItems[_playerId].add(itemId);
            ownedItems[_owner].remove(itemId);
        }
    }

    // Set game information on items added via addItemsToPlayer
    function addItemsToGame(uint _gameId, uint[] memory _playerIds) public {
        require(msg.sender == address(games), "Not games contract");
        for (uint i = 0; i < _playerIds.length; i++) {
            EnumerableSet.UintSet storage playerItems = playerToItems[
                _playerIds[i]
            ];
            for (uint k = 0; k < playerItems.length(); k++) {
                uint itemId = playerItems.at(k);
                items[itemId].currentGame = _gameId;
                gameToItems[_gameId].add(itemId);
            }
        }
        // TODO:
        // gameToEventBlocks[_gameId].add(block.number);
    }

    // At the end of the game, items still held by player go into their owners
    // out-of-game inventory
    // CRITICAL: ONLY CALLED BY games.leaveGame()!!!
    function takeItemsHome(uint _playerId, uint _gameId) public {
        require(msg.sender == address(games), "Not games contract");

        EnumerableSet.UintSet storage itemsTaken = playerToItems[_playerId];
        address newOwner = playersContract.extGetPlayerOwner(_playerId);

        // iterate backwards to allow modifying set during loop without early ending
        uint numItems = itemsTaken.length();
        for (uint i = numItems; i > 0; i--) {
            uint itemId = itemsTaken.at(i - 1);
            BCTypes.Item storage item = items[itemId];

            item.holdingPlayerId = 0;
            item.ownerAddress = newOwner;
            item.currentGame = 0;
            item.status = BCTypes.WorldItemStatus.OUT_OF_GAME;

            ownedItems[newOwner].add(itemId);
            itemsTaken.remove(itemId);
            _removeItemFromGameToItem(_gameId, itemId);
        }
    }

    function _createNewItem(
        uint _holdingPlayerId,
        address _holderAddress,
        uint _gameId
    ) internal {
        // I don't _think_ this is a reentrancy risk be cause I control the receiving address
        // TODO: Make sure passing payment this way is safe
        // TODO: DOUBLY SO FOR THIS ONE!!!!
        // TODO: Update costs for by-type payment scheme
        uint uifID = uif.mintItem{value: 100 gwei}(4, 0, _holderAddress); // TODO: Hardcoded value
        bytes32 finalHash = uif.extGetProperties(uifID);

        // First pass interpretation will make weapons, armor, and stat boosters
        // Items with special abilities will be dealt with after that system is implemented

        BCTypes.Item storage newItem = items.push();

        newItem.genHash = finalHash;

        newItem.id = items.length - 1; // -1 because we've already pushed
        newItem.uifID = uifID;

        newItem.holdingPlayerId = _holdingPlayerId;

        newItem.weight = 1;

        newItem.itemCategory = sliceHashToSmallInt(
            finalHash,
            4,
            getUIOffset(1, 0)
        ) >= 11
            ? BCTypes.ItemCategory.SCAVENGER
            : BCTypes.ItemCategory.ARTIFACT; // Quality <= 11 is 2/3 scav items.  // TODO: Eval

        newItem.grantsAbility = 0; // NO abilities or flaws for now
        newItem.grantsFlaw = 0;

        newItem.itemType = _getItemType(
            sliceHashToSmallInt(finalHash, 4, getUIOffset(0, 1))
        );

        uint8 newItemPower = sliceHashToSmallInt(
            finalHash,
            4,
            getUIOffset(1, 2)
        );
        if (newItem.itemCategory == BCTypes.ItemCategory.SCAVENGER) {
            newItemPower = (newItemPower * 2) / 3; // TODO: Evaluate nerfing scav items
        }
        newItemPower = normalizeToSmallRange(1, 4, newItemPower, 15);

        newItem.power = newItemPower;

        newItem.currentGame = _gameId;
        newItem.status = BCTypes.WorldItemStatus.HELD;
        // TODO: Dry this
        playerToItems[_holdingPlayerId].add(newItem.id);
        gameToItems[_gameId].add(newItem.id);
        // TODO: Event
    }

    function _getItemType(
        uint _value
    ) internal pure returns (BCTypes.ItemType) {
        // TODO: UIF Spec is incomplete, most items will be unusable for now
        if (_value <= 1) {
            return BCTypes.ItemType.CONSUMABLE;
        } else if (_value <= 2) {
            return BCTypes.ItemType.HEALTH;
        } else if (_value <= 3) {
            return BCTypes.ItemType.CARRY;
        } else if (_value <= 4) {
            return BCTypes.ItemType.DEFENSE;
        } else if (_value <= 5) {
            return BCTypes.ItemType.HACK;
        } else if (_value <= 6) {
            return BCTypes.ItemType.BREACH;
        } else if (_value <= 8) {
            return BCTypes.ItemType.HAZARD;
        } else if (_value <= 10) {
            return BCTypes.ItemType.ARMOR;
        } else if (_value <= 12) {
            return BCTypes.ItemType.RANGED;
        } else if (_value <= 14) {
            return BCTypes.ItemType.MELEE;
        } else {
            return BCTypes.ItemType.SPECIAL;
        }
    }

    function commitItemToMission() public {
        // TODO:
        // Require you own this item and it's not in game
    }

    // TODO: Complete This
    // Get all items, held by players, and on the ground
    // function getItemsInGame() {

    // }

    function _removeItemFromPlayerToItem(
        uint _playerId,
        uint _itemId
    ) internal {
        // TODO: Validate error is needed, and probably use assert
        require(
            playerToItems[_playerId].contains(_itemId),
            "Player doesn't have this item!"
        );
        playerToItems[_playerId].remove(_itemId);
    }

    function _removeItemFromGameToItem(uint _gameId, uint _itemId) internal {
        // TODO: Validate error is needed, and probably use assert
        require(
            gameToItems[_gameId].contains(_itemId),
            "Game doesn't have this item!"
        );
        gameToItems[_gameId].remove(_itemId);
    }

    function destroyItem(uint _playerId, uint _itemId) public {
        // TODO: CRITICAL -> Ensure complete test coverage
        require(
            msg.sender == gamesContract ||
                msg.sender == address(playersContract),
            "Not allowed contract"
        );
        BCTypes.Item storage item = items[_itemId];

        _removeItemFromPlayerToItem(_playerId, _itemId);
        _removeItemFromGameToItem(item.currentGame, _itemId);

        item.holdingPlayerId = 0;
        item.currentGame = 0;

        // TODO: Handle invincible legendaries here if that becomes a thing
        // TODO: Handle safe item if that becomes a thing
        // Burn the NFT

        // TODO: CRITICAL -> Debug NFT ownership issue
        // TODO: Use recycle, not burn, to give game credit for recycling
        // uif.burn(_itemId); // Sad but necessary :(
    }

    function _countWorldItems(uint _gameId) internal view returns (uint) {
        uint counter;

        EnumerableSet.UintSet storage ids = gameToItems[_gameId];

        uint length = ids.length();
        for (uint i = 0; i < length; i++) {
            if (items[ids.at(i)].status == BCTypes.WorldItemStatus.ON_GROUND) {
                counter++;
            }
        }

        return counter;
    }

    // Same notes as below about the set
    // Returns the ids of items that are currently on the ground in the selected game
    function getWorldItemIds(uint _gameId) public view returns (uint[] memory) {
        uint count = _countWorldItems(_gameId);
        uint cursor;
        uint[] memory itemIds = new uint[](count);

        EnumerableSet.UintSet storage ids = gameToItems[_gameId];

        uint length = ids.length();
        for (uint i = 0; i < length; i++) {
            if (items[ids.at(i)].status == BCTypes.WorldItemStatus.ON_GROUND) {
                itemIds[cursor] = ids.at(i);
                cursor++;
            }
        }

        return itemIds;
    }

    // Same notes as below about the set
    // Returns the ids of items that are currently on the ground in the selected game
    function getWorldItems(
        uint _gameId
    ) public view returns (BCTypes.Item[] memory) {
        uint count = _countWorldItems(_gameId);
        uint cursor;
        BCTypes.Item[] memory worldItems = new BCTypes.Item[](count);

        EnumerableSet.UintSet storage ids = gameToItems[_gameId];

        uint length = ids.length();
        for (uint i = 0; i < length; i++) {
            if (items[ids.at(i)].status == BCTypes.WorldItemStatus.ON_GROUND) {
                worldItems[cursor] = items[ids.at(i)];
                cursor++;
            }
        }

        return worldItems;
    }

    // TODO: D should be lowercase
    // Per notes in EnumerableSet, this can be problematic because it's unbounded and
    // will copy the entire storage.
    // I don't think it's a problem here, because the player shouldn't really ever
    // have more than 10 items
    function getItemIDsByPlayer(
        uint _playerID
    ) public view returns (uint[] memory) {
        return playerToItems[_playerID].values();
    }

    // This could be expensive, don't use in contract
    // Gets the out of game item ids owned by a wallet
    function getOwnedItemIds(
        address _address
    ) external view returns (uint[] memory) {
        return ownedItems[_address].values();
    }

    // Gets the out of game items themselves
    function getOwnedItems(
        address _address
    ) external view returns (BCTypes.Item[] memory) {
        BCTypes.Item[] memory itemsOwned = new BCTypes.Item[](
            ownedItems[_address].length()
        );
        for (uint i = 0; i < itemsOwned.length; i++) {
            uint itemId = ownedItems[_address].at(i);
            itemsOwned[i] = items[itemId];
        }
        return itemsOwned;
    }

    // Per notes in EnumerableSet, this can be problematic because it's unbounded and
    // will copy the entire storage.
    // I don't think it's a problem here, because the player shouldn't really ever
    // have more than 10 items
    function getItemsByPlayer(
        uint _playerID
    ) public view returns (BCTypes.Item[] memory) {
        BCTypes.Item[] memory itemsOwned = new BCTypes.Item[](
            playerToItems[_playerID].length()
        );
        for (uint i = 0; i < itemsOwned.length; i++) {
            uint itemId = playerToItems[_playerID].at(i);
            itemsOwned[i] = items[itemId];
        }
        return itemsOwned;
    }

    function getAllPlayersItems(
        uint _gameId
    ) public view returns (BCTypes.Item[][] memory) {
        uint[] memory playerIds = games.extGetGamePlayerIndexes(_gameId);

        BCTypes.Item[][] memory allItems = new BCTypes.Item[][](
            playerIds.length
        );

        for (uint i = 0; i < playerIds.length; i++) {
            allItems[i] = getItemsByPlayer(playerIds[i]);
        }

        return allItems;
    }

    function getItemsIdsInGame(
        uint _gameId
    ) external view returns (uint[] memory) {
        return gameToItems[_gameId].values();
    }

    // Per notes in EnumerableSet, this can be problematic because it's unbounded and
    // will copy the entire storage.
    // I don't think it's a problem here, because the player shouldn't really ever
    // have more than 10 items
    // Apply item modifiers (and eventually powers)
    // NOTE that for items, only the highest counts, they do not stack!
    // TODO: This doesn't mesh with choosing which item to attack with
    function getTraitModifiers(
        uint _playerId
    ) public view returns (BCTypes.Traits memory) {
        EnumerableSet.UintSet storage itemIds = playerToItems[_playerId];

        BCTypes.Traits memory modifiers;

        for (uint i = 0; i < itemIds.length(); i++) {
            BCTypes.Item storage item = items[itemIds.at(i)];

            if (item.itemType == BCTypes.ItemType.HEALTH) {
                if (modifiers.health < int8(item.power)) {
                    modifiers.health = int8(item.power);
                }
            } else if (item.itemType == BCTypes.ItemType.CARRY) {
                if (modifiers.carry < int8(item.power)) {
                    modifiers.carry = int8(item.power);
                }
            } else if (item.itemType == BCTypes.ItemType.DEFENSE) {
                if (modifiers.defense < int8(item.power)) {
                    modifiers.defense = int8(item.power);
                }
            } else if (item.itemType == BCTypes.ItemType.HACK) {
                if (modifiers.hack < int8(item.power)) {
                    modifiers.hack = int8(item.power);
                }
            } else if (item.itemType == BCTypes.ItemType.BREACH) {
                if (modifiers.breach < int8(item.power)) {
                    modifiers.breach = int8(item.power);
                }
            } else if (item.itemType == BCTypes.ItemType.RANGED) {
                if (modifiers.shoot < int8(item.power)) {
                    modifiers.shoot = int8(item.power);
                    modifiers.hasGun = true;
                }
            } else if (item.itemType == BCTypes.ItemType.MELEE) {
                if (modifiers.melee < int8(item.power)) {
                    modifiers.melee = int8(item.power);
                }
            }
        }

        // TODO: Add penalty and bonus modifiers

        return modifiers;
    }

    function transferFundsOut() public onlyOwner {
        // TODO: Track and limit to transferable balance, leaving enough for buybacks
        payable(owner()).transfer(address(this).balance);
    }

    function setMintingStatus(bool _status) public onlyOwner {
        mintIsActive = _status;
    }

    // TODO: Evaluate if I want to charge on top of the UIF fee
    function SetMintCostInMatic(uint _matic) public onlyOwner {
        mintCost = _matic * 10 ** 18;
    }

    function onERC721Received(
        address _operator,
        address _from,
        uint256 _tokenId,
        bytes calldata _data
    ) external override returns (bytes4) {
        _operator;
        _from;
        _tokenId;
        _data;
        emit Received();
        return 0x150b7a02;
    }
}
","keccak256":"0x40c449fdf431088e24275785fa2f22365f1de9e935a5039c793b3072aa76d136","license":"UNLICENSED"},"contracts/BCTypes.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: UNLICENSED
pragma solidity ^0.8.17;

import "hardhat/console.sol";

contract BCTypes {
    // From BCGames.sol
    enum DoorStatus {
        NO_DOOR,
        CLOSED,
        OPEN,
        BREACHED,
        WINDOW
    }
    enum Action {
        HACK,
        BREACH,
        MOVE,
        PASS,
        LOOT,
        USE_ROOM,
        USE_ITEM,
        DROP_ITEMS,
        PICK_ITEMS,
        LEAVE_GAME,
        MELEE_ATTACK,
        SHOOT_ATTACK,
        LOOT_DENIZEN
    } // TODO: Add rest
    enum Followthrough {
        NONE,
        MOVE
    }
    enum BCEventType {
        NONE,
        BUG,
        MYSTERY,
        SCAVENGER,
        SHIP_SECURITY,
        ROOM // TODO: Is this still useful
    }
    enum WorldItemStatus {
        DESTROYED,
        HELD,
        ON_GROUND,
        DISCARDED,
        OUT_OF_GAME
    }

    enum ItemCategory {
        COMPANY,
        ARTIFACT,
        SCAVENGER
    }
    enum ItemType {
        CONSUMABLE,
        HEALTH,
        CARRY,
        DEFENSE,
        HACK,
        BREACH,
        HAZARD,
        ARMOR,
        RANGED,
        MELEE,
        SPECIAL
    }

    enum DenizenType {
        NONE,
        BUG,
        SCAV,
        TURRET,
        ROBOT,
        QUEEN,
        BUTCHER,
        BEHEMOTH,
        DOCTOR
    }

    // WARNING: At stack limit
    struct Player {
        address owner;
        uint256 characterId;
        uint id; // playerId;
        Traits currentTraits; // Char traits plus effects of items etc.
        Position position;
        Position lastPos; // This is needed for events that use the player's prior position
        // 20,000 (probably actually just 5k plus, but still) to write a word vs. 3 to add numbers, will not store updated characteristics
        // Now think this doesn't save much because of overhead to read across contracts, saving for now in BCTypes.Player
        int8 healthDmgTaken; // TODO: eval cons of this being int, using to give bonus health
        uint8 armorDmgTaken;
        uint8 actionsTaken;
        uint8 dataTokens; // TODO: Consider payout model that approaches a limit?  First 4 pay 1, second 4 pay .5, third .25, etc.  Limit of 2.  Adds interesting motiviation
        uint8[] currentEffects; // Use mapping and mark true if effect is present
        uint8 numItemsHeld;
        // Flags

        bool dead; // Move to traits?
        uint gameId;
    }

    struct Denizen {
        uint id;
        uint gameId;
        DenizenType denizenType; // Traits are derived from type. //TODO: rename to type
        Position position;
        uint healthRemaining; // Denizen is dead if this is zero
        bool looted;
    }

    struct EventTracker {
        uint8 bugEvents;
        uint8 mysteryEvents;
        uint8 scavEvents;
        uint8 shipEvents;
    }

    struct Position {
        uint8 row;
        uint8 col;
    }

    struct GameTile {
        // Position pos;
        // uint8 timesUsed;  // Used to turn off egg room, etc.
        uint8 roomId;
        uint8 parentId;
        uint[4] doors; // n, s, e, w // TODO: Make an enum for this.  Also,, this should be named doorIds
        bool explored;
        bool looted;
        bool hasVent;
        bool hasHazard;
    }

    struct Door {
        uint8 vsBreach;
        uint8 vsHack;
        DoorStatus status;
    }

    struct Map {
        uint[] unusedNormalRooms;
        // Row, Col => GameTile
        mapping(uint => mapping(uint => GameTile)) board;
        mapping(uint => Door) doors;
        uint8 numDoors;
        Position startPosition;
        uint mainReactorRow;
        uint mainReactorCol;
    }

    struct Game {
        // TODO: Consider adding contract addresses to games to handle versioning
        bool active;
        bool denizenTurn;
        uint gameId;
        uint[] playerIndexes; // TODO: Rename playerIds
        uint[] charIds;
        uint currentPlayerTurnIndex; // TODO: Default of player zero
        uint numPlayers;
        uint turnsTaken;
        EventTracker eventTracker;
        // address mapContract;  // TODO: If making separately upgradable, need all addys in game
        uint mapId;
        uint eventPlayerId;
        uint eventNumber;
        BCEventType eventType;
        Position eventPosition;
        uint[] unusedBugEvents;
        uint[] unusedMysteryEvents;
        uint[] unusedScavEvents;
        uint[] unusedShipEvents;
        uint turnTimeLimit;
        uint lastTurnTimestamp;
        uint[] denizenIds;
    }

    struct Lobby {
        bool gameStarted;
        uint8 numberOfPlayers;
        uint[] playerIndexes;

        // uint expireTime; TODO: Lobbys should possibly expire, or maybe set a timer to allow starting with three
    }

    // From RoomTiles.sol
    struct RoomTile {
        BCEventType eventType;
        uint256 eventNum; // 0 if no event in room
        uint8 numItems;
        uint8 numData;
        // bool hasHazard; // TODO:  Should hazards be handled by events only?
        bool sigDetected; // TODO:  Doesn't work with current map generation
        // TODO: Split map list into those with and without sigs
    }

    // From BCChars.sol
    struct Traits {
        int8 health;
        int8 carry;
        int8 defense;
        int8 hack;
        int8 breach;
        int8 shoot;
        int8 melee;
        bool hasGun;
        // bool hasEgg;
        // bool canHarmOthers; // Need stack space
    }

    struct Character {
        bytes32 genHash; // TODO: Eval storing these properties
        uint id; // Id in the characters array
        uint uifID; // ID in UIF
        Traits traits;
        uint8 cloneNumber; // High but possibly reachable limit // TODO: Move to UiF
        uint8 maxClones; // Eventually exit them from the economy??
        uint8 ability;
        uint8 flaw;
        // uint holdingPlayerId; // TODO: Eval if this is needed
        bool inGame; // For now, keep both.  Enlisting puts you in a lobby, but don't know game id yet
        uint gameId; // TODO: CRITICAL-> Handle leaving games!!!
    }

    // WARNING:  At stack limit
    struct Item {
        bytes32 genHash; // TODO: Eval storing this here
        uint id;
        uint uifID;
        uint holdingPlayerId; // TODO: Eval if this is needed
        address ownerAddress; // Set when taken out of game, remove when brought in
        uint weight;
        ItemCategory itemCategory;
        uint8 grantsAbility; // TODO: Align with char abilities
        uint8 grantsFlaw;
        ItemType itemType;
        uint8 power; // damage, armor level, etc... // TODO: Define this
        // uint8 level;
        // bool asAnAction; // TODO: Derive from itemType
        // bool consumable; // TODO: Derive from UIF and/or itemType

        uint currentGame;
        WorldItemStatus status;
        Position position; // 0, 0 UNLESS the item is on the ground
    }
}
","keccak256":"0x2bd9b3e08641fafa559b4f0dabb0d434c9845dbb3fbc18cad6e06f80d1bd75bd","license":"UNLICENSED"},"contracts/BCUtils.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: UNLICENSED
pragma solidity ^0.8.17;

import "hardhat/console.sol";
import "@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/Strings.sol";
import "@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/structs/EnumerableSet.sol";

import "./BCTypes.sol";

contract BCUtils {
    using EnumerableSet for EnumerableSet.UintSet;

    uint constant DEFAULT_ROLL_RES = 3; // TODO: Decide to split to hack, breach, defense, etc.

    event ChallengeEvent(uint gameId, uint roll, uint forValue, uint against);
    event DiceRollEvent(uint gameId, uint roll);

    // TODO: Random seed will be replaced with a value from an oracle
    // TODO: Add budget for oracle derived from enlistment fees, or just make my own
    // TODO: Alternately, I think using the hash of the last block should be safe enough.  Only 2 seconds to do an attack
    uint private TODO_randomSeed = 0;

    mapping(uint256 => EnumerableSet.UintSet) gameToEventBlocks;

    function smallIntBetweenVals(
        uint8 _min,
        uint8 _max
    ) public returns (uint8) {
        TODO_randomSeed++;
        uint rand = uint256(
            keccak256(
                abi.encodePacked(
                    msg.sender,
                    TODO_randomSeed,
                    blockhash(block.number - 1)
                )
            )
        );
        uint8 mod = _max - _min + 1;

        return uint8((rand % mod) + _min);
    }

    // function smallIntBetweenVals256(uint _min, uint _max) public returns(uint) {
    //     TODO_randomSeed++;
    //     uint rand = uint256(keccak256(abi.encodePacked(msg.sender, TODO_randomSeed, blockhash(block.number-1))));
    //     uint mod = _max - _min + 1;

    //     return (rand % mod) + _min;
    // }

    function roll(uint _gameId) public returns (uint) {
        uint rollResult = uint(smallIntBetweenVals(1, 6));
        emit DiceRollEvent(_gameId, rollResult);
        return rollResult;
    }

    function randKeccak() public returns (bytes32) {
        TODO_randomSeed++;
        return (
            keccak256(
                abi.encodePacked(
                    TODO_randomSeed,
                    blockhash(block.number - 1),
                    msg.sender
                )
            )
        );
    }

    function abs(int x) public pure returns (int) {
        // TODO: Why isn't this returning uint?
        return x >= 0 ? x : -x;
    }

    // Given a number and max, find the normalized value between two ranges
    // This requires _val to be equal to _valMax for the result to equal _max,
    // Design accordingly
    function normalizeToSmallRange(
        uint _min,
        uint _max,
        uint _val,
        uint _valMax
    ) public pure returns (uint8) {
        uint adjustedMax = _max - _min;

        uint result = (adjustedMax * _val) / _valMax;
        return uint8(result + _min);
    }

    // Convert part of a hash into an int by grabbing _size bits at _offset
    function sliceHashToSmallInt(
        bytes32 _hash,
        uint256 _size,
        uint256 _offset
    ) public pure returns (uint8) {
        bytes32 mask = bytes32((2 ** _size) - 1) << _offset;
        return uint8(uint256(bytes32((_hash & mask) >> _offset)));
    }

    // Returns the offset in BITS for a given Universal Inventory item characteristic
    function getUIOffset(
        uint _traitNum,
        uint _subTraitNum
    ) public pure returns (uint) {
        return (4 * _traitNum + _subTraitNum);
    }

    // Returns direction from _firstRoom 0,1,2,3 -> nsew
    function getDirectionBetween(
        BCTypes.Position memory _firstRoom,
        BCTypes.Position memory _secondRoom
    ) public pure returns (uint) {
        if (int8(_firstRoom.row) - int8(_secondRoom.row) == 1) {
            return 0;
        } else if (int8(_firstRoom.row) - int8(_secondRoom.row) == -1) {
            return 1;
        } else if (int8(_firstRoom.col) - int8(_secondRoom.col) == -1) {
            return 2;
        } else if (int8(_firstRoom.col) - int8(_secondRoom.col) == 1) {
            return 3;
        }

        revert("Error: Not adjacent");
    }

    function getNeighborRoom(
        uint _direction,
        BCTypes.Position memory _start
    ) public pure returns (BCTypes.Position memory) {
        // North
        if (_direction == 0) {
            return BCTypes.Position(_start.row - 1, _start.col);
        }
        // South
        if (_direction == 1) {
            return BCTypes.Position(_start.row + 1, _start.col);
        }
        // East
        if (_direction == 2) {
            return BCTypes.Position(_start.row, _start.col + 1);
        }
        // West
        if (_direction == 3) {
            return BCTypes.Position(_start.row, _start.col - 1);
        }
        string memory message = string.concat(
            "Invalid direction: ",
            Strings.toString(_direction)
        );
        revert(message);
    }

    // Return true if _for beats against with the roll
    function resolveChallenge(
        uint _gameId,
        uint _for,
        uint _against
    ) public returns (bool) {
        uint diceRoll = roll(_gameId);
        emit ChallengeEvent(_gameId, diceRoll, _for, _against);
        if (diceRoll == 1) {
            return false;
        }

        if (int(diceRoll + _for) - int(_against) > int(DEFAULT_ROLL_RES)) {
            return true;
        }
        return false;
    }

    // Return the opposite direction NSEW == 0123
    function opposite(uint _direction) public pure returns (uint) {
        // TODO: There's something more clever for this (not a dict) but can't remember
        if (_direction == 0) {
            return 1;
        }
        if (_direction == 1) {
            return 0;
        }
        if (_direction == 2) {
            return 3;
        }
        if (_direction == 3) {
            return 2;
        }
        revert("Bad direction");
    }

    function manhattanDistance(
        BCTypes.Position memory _pos1,
        BCTypes.Position memory _pos2
    ) public pure returns (uint) {
        uint row = uint(abs(int(int8(_pos1.row)) - int(int8(_pos2.row))));
        uint col = uint(abs(int(int8(_pos1.col)) - int(int8(_pos2.col))));
        return row + col;
    }

    function getEventBlocks(uint _gameId) public view returns (uint[] memory) {
        return gameToEventBlocks[_gameId].values();
    }
}
","keccak256":"0x2d46431e29668b3c032cad26d21875d590d63c532d5a752475af7725b9197ccd","license":"UNLICENSED"},"hardhat/console.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
pragma solidity >= 0.4.22 <0.9.0;

library console {
	address constant CONSOLE_ADDRESS = address(0x000000000000000000636F6e736F6c652e6c6f67);

	function _sendLogPayload(bytes memory payload) private view {
		uint256 payloadLength = payload.length;
		address consoleAddress = CONSOLE_ADDRESS;
		assembly {
			let payloadStart := add(payload, 32)
			let r := staticcall(gas(), consoleAddress, payloadStart, payloadLength, 0, 0)
		}
	}

	function log() internal view {
		_sendLogPayload(abi.encodeWithSignature("log()"));
	}

	function logInt(int256 p0) internal view {
		_sendLogPayload(abi.encodeWithSignature("log(int256)", p0));
	}

	function logUint(uint256 p0) internal view {
		_sendLogPayload(abi.encodeWithSignature("log(uint256)", p0));
	}

	function logString(string memory p0) internal view {
		_sendLogPayload(abi.encodeWithSignature("log(string)", p0));
	}

	function logBool(bool p0) internal view {
		_sendLogPayload(abi.encodeWithSignature("log(bool)", p0));
	}

	function logAddress(address p0) internal view {
		_sendLogPayload(abi.encodeWithSignature("log(address)", p0));
	}

	function logBytes(bytes memory p0) internal view {
		_sendLogPayload(abi.encodeWithSignature("log(bytes)", p0));

	function logBytes29(bytes29 p0) internal view {

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.
